As per the details of the deed, you are my son. Due to the love I have for you, I have acquired a vacant land from my ancestors and inherited it as a freehold. On the said land, I have constructed an R.C.C. slab house with my own money and have a house tax receipt in my name in the Gram Panchayat for the said house and I am in full possession of the following schedule of Rs. 6,22,000.00 I hereby transfer to you, without any consideration, the said land, the R.C.C.Slab Terrace House built on the said land, valued at six lakh twenty two thousand rupees, and the said R.C.C.Slab Terrace House built on the said land, as per the schedule, and I hereby transfer to you, without any consideration, the said land, the R.C.C.Slab Terrace House built on the said land, as per the schedule, and I hereby transfer to you, this very day, the said land, the said Endorsement

Scanned with OKEN Scanner I shall never have any quarrel or trouble with you or your heirs or me or my heirs. I hereby declare that the property as per the said schedule I hereby certify to you that the property is undisputed and unencumbered and that I have not committed any encroachments on it and hereby give you a deed of title in your name. I hereby declare that I will settle any disputes or disputes arising out of the said property at my own expense and keep this property in your possession. I hereby submit a notice form to the Gram Panchayat for the transfer of the property in your name as per the schedule. This property has not been assigned. This property does not belong to the Government or its affiliated institutions and is not a property on which the above institutions have any securities or mortgages. In case of any dispute, the Government shall refer the matter to the Indian Stamp Act, Andhra Pradesh Amendment Act No. 16/2002, as amended by section 70(2), in case of any default in payment of stamp duty, I hereby certify that I am liable to pay a penalty of three times the actual stamp duty under section 41A. I hereby certify that I have duly recorded in the deed the full facts relating to the levy of stamp duty under section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899, the consideration for the purchase of the property, the market value of the property and the stamp duty payable on the said deed. If I fail to act as provided in section 27 above, I shall be liable to pay the said amount along with penalty and stamp duty payable from time to time under sections 64 and 64A. I hereby declare that I consent to be prosecuted under section 70 for the purpose of collecting the amount due. I hereby enclose with the plan all the particulars necessary for the identification of the property, including the boundaries, door number, full address etc., in accordance with section 21 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908. I have read and heard all the matters herein in full in the presence of the witnesses below. I hereby acknowledge that all these are as stated by me and that the scribe has written as I have said.
This is a deed of immovable property, R.C.C. Club House and Garden built on the said land.
My name is OKEN Scanner Schedule

No. 1413208001840 and all the wooden furniture attached to the said property. I hereby give you possession of the property. This property is a property in the survey number 717 of the village of Miriyala.

Declaration
This declaration is to inform that in the course of preparing this document, we have brought all the necessary documents such as the details of the property in the document, the tax receipts of the places, houses, the details of the parties in the linked document, the addresses of the parties, the details of the property, etc. and we have thoroughly examined all the aspects and included them in this document and have prepared the document. No matter that should have been written or included has been left out in this document. The schedule property has been physically inspected and measured and as per Section-22B After examining the E.C. of this property, it was ascertained that no mortgage, sale or encumbrance of this property has been made to anyone and this deed was registered. And we will be fully responsible for any depreciation stamp found in the future during the inspection of the property in the said document by the authorities (Registration & Stamps and Revenue Department). There is no connection between the Shri Sub-Registrar and the writer of the document. I hereby declare that the property mentioned in the document is a legal property inherited by me and has not been alienated to anyone before and if it is found that the provisions of section 22B of the Registration Act, 1908 are violated, I will be liable to the punishment to be imposed by the Government under section 82 of the Registration Act. I/We declare that we have read this document in full and have given our full consent to the declaration.

boundaries.boundaryN: 3 Ft Width 56 Ft Podavuna Ee Property Koraku Nenu Vadalabadina Galli Bazar

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 4094 of 2025, dated 16/Jun/2025, executed by Mamidi Daniyelu in favour of his Son, Mamidi Yesu Babu towards the property admeasuring an extent of 79.44 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-42, Assessment No. 1042, comprised in survey number 717, situated in Miriyala Village & Grama Panchayati, Karempudi Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Gurajala, is bounded as follows: North by: 3 Ft Width 56 Ft Podavuna Ee Property Koraku Nenu Vadalabadina Galli Bazar South by: Kandukuri Prabhudasu House 32.6 Ft East by: Mamidi Yesuratnam House 23 Ft West by: Mamidi Abelu House 23 Ft Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
